Articles.Content:
Have one central tank, and need to equally distribute to multiple radial tanks?

Right click on them all, and click out on the central tank, and it fills the radial tanks equally. Also draws from them equally too.

Awesome update.

\o/

FINALY!
So that's how it works?

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, and F to change between part relative and global relative movement in the editor

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, and F to change between part relative and global relative movement in the editor

So good...

Not really a post, but...yeah.

I'll be going now.

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, and F to change between part relative and global relative movement in the editor

Was one of the first things I found on a launch. I always monitor multiple fuel tank draws to see what's happening, and so I started the transfer to see how it functioned. Voila.
Really????????????????? I must confirm this. If this is true, this is the truly the greatest update KSP has ever had.

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, and F to change between part relative and global relative movement in the editor

And here I was just about to ask for moving parts in their local axis.
I wish I would have seen this earlier >< I just spent a long time doing each tank one at a time.

I noticed this too. It's a great quality of life feature.

Also, while we're on the topic of less known features, the Mark 55 got a well needed buff. It has a better Isp and the gimbal was increased even more.

Edited December 18, 2014 by xub313

Awesome, the lack of more multi-fuel transfer was always really annoying. Thanks for the input!

Edited December 19, 2014 by Temeter
This is the best feature of the update (and I like the other features).

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, [...]

so that's why I ended up with the radial symmetry in the SPH!

I was sure it was a bug XD

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

Also, press R to toggle between radial and mirror symmetry, and F to change between part relative and global relative movement in the editor

One badly needed feature is the 'center lock' toggle from the editor expansion mod. Press V and parts are locked to the 'center' of the parent part.
I must be dense tonight. Why can't I transfer fuel inflight between some radial tanks and a central tank. I got a kerbal going to crash because the old way does not work.

I must be dense tonight. Why can't I transfer fuel inflight between some radial tanks and a central tank. I got a kerbal going to crash because the old way does not work.

You need to upgrade the R&D to tier 2 to get fuel transfer.
Best news I've seen so far... TO THE VAB!!!
The R one is a bit of a control clash, since Alt/RShift+R does the no radial attachment. It makes it easy to accidentally change the symmetry mode.

Lol I was wondering how long it'd take to find that.

It was in the readme and online feature list, dammit...

It's quite a cool update though. Actually makes the crazy money from 0.24 make some sense

Didn't see this one in the release notes! thanks for letting us know!

Having to transfer to each radial tank properly so it doesn't shift the center of mass was a pain!
Kalleluja! It truly is Krissmas! ^^

since Alt/RShift+R does the no radial attachment.

Whaaaat? How it works?

WHAAAAAAAAAAAAT?

We can do this now? No joke?

*transfers ALL the fuel to ALL the places*

When I first read the OP, I just about jumped up and danced a jig for joy. At work.

With balanced *simultaneous* fuel transfer into the central tank, my old V0.24 low-tech Mun lander goes from a hopeless deathtrap to a useful vehicle! I can finally LAND in it rather than plow into a crater while still frantically shoving fuel into the central tank!

Oh, wait. I just said "low tech". And fuel transfer can't be done at all until after the expensive (oh so VERY expensive) R&D building upgrade.

Aw, nuts.

On the plus side, I didn't lose my job due to insane dancing about...

Is fuel transfer disabled until you research it?

I can't get any fuel transfer in Career mode yet, and haven't tried it in Sandbox mode.
